thread.title: 10 Spots for Finger Lickin’ Good Fried Chicken
thread.title_full: 10 Spots for Finger Lickin’ Good Fried Chicken

author: Keri Bridgwater
title: 10 Spots for Finger Lickin’ Good Fried Chicken
text:
10 Spots for Finger Lickin’ Good Fried Chicken All Feb 21, 2017, 1:16pm PST Streetcar Merchants Yelp 
Juicy, flavorful, and with just the right amount of crunch: fried chicken is hands-down America’s favorite comfort food. Whether Southern-style thighs, twice fried Korean-style tenders or buttermilk brined wings are your weakness, nothing tastes quite like succulent pieces of lightly breaded poultry. 
With Eater officially declaring 2016 the year of fried chicken, a recent Business Insider article tapped it as the new 'fast food industry king' for 2017, beating out the long-reigning burger. But this versatile delicacy doesn't only taste amazing it's an equal opportunist too - enjoy first thing with waffles over breakfast, as your go-to order on game day or a late night, post bar hopping snack. 
While we eagerly await the arrival of Filipino chain Max’s of Manila , for now let us acquaint you with ten winning chicken dinner destinations around town where 'Wing Wednesday' cravings and more can be satisfied. 
Did we miss a favorite spot? Let us know on the tip line . 
- Please note map points are not ranked. 1 Krispy Krunchy Chicken 
You’ll find this Cajun-style fried chicken spot tucked inside the new 99 Ranch Market on Balboa. The chicken here is moist, flavorful, lightly breaded and comes in several forms, including Buffalo wings, Cajun tenders, and a crispy chicken sandwich. The combos are probably the most popular option, ranging in price from $7 to $10 for two, three or four-pieces they can also come with a biscuit, side and drink.
